summary: The Protecting Military Assets Act of 2025 amends the Immigration and Nationality Act. It makes aliens inadmissible to the U.S. and deportable if they have been convicted of, admitted to committing, or committed acts constituting an offense related to entering military, naval, or Coast Guard property, specifically referencing 18 U.S. Code § 1382. The bill aims to protect U.S. military assets by restricting access and imposing consequences for violations of military property regulations.
